intro: Geissanthera tubulosa, commonly known as the tubular geranium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. The flowers, which can be pink, red, or white, bloom in late summer and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
